text: Almost black with a small off-white head. Aroma is wood, bourbon and vanilla. Taste is sweet with notes of dark fruit and cocoa

Bottle at tasting. Brown pour. Aroma of thick bourbon vanilla, caramelised malt, raisin and ripe fruit. Flavor is a beast, with lots of bourbon vanilla, raisin, caramelised malt, ripe fruit and booze. Realy strong bourbon flavor, leans towards an actual bourbon.

Bottle. 2015 edition which comes at 12% abv. It pours dark brown with a small beige head. The aroma is huge oaky and full of ripe fruits. Dark malts, vanilla and port. Dark malty and ripe fruity flavor with chocolate and loads of oak.

Tastes strongly of raisin and maple syrup. Smells sort of winey, burnt wine hahaha... Wine and brandy on the palate, a big rich, malty, creamy, and surprisingly mellow body. Sweet liquor like sipper, medicinal, vanilla, wood, and caramel. Very good.

Pours entirely flat, with no head to speak of, almost black, with a brighter hazelnut quality to it.

Has a prominent, wooden alcohol bite on the nose, with lots of oak and earth, toning down the spices of the barrel. A toffee note evolves from this, sweet and rustic, with a dried raisin peak and lots of toasted coconut. Pretty complex, a new aroma nuance seems to be found, everytime I put my nose in the glass. 

Drinks silk and slick with no hint of carbonation, showcasing each and every flavor quality. Its mouthfeel is medium bodied and entertaining till the last moment. 

The beers taste is not as complex as its nose, it got a defining silkness, together with a very powerful barrel, soothed by the soft mouthfeel. Chocolate pudding with some banana in it, bakers chocolate, molasses, black pepper and licorice. A charred wood bark quality sets in, together with toffee and the initially established silkness. A nice chocolate and wood defined alcohol dryness results from this, warming and flavorful with more toffee and a caramel sweet finish.

Sweet, boozy, silk and oaken, these flavors define the beer, put into perfect balance to each other due to the soothing, silk mouthfeel.

Bottle from Amsterdam, De Bierkonig. Colour is very dark brown with a thin off white head. Nose is hoppy, marmite, spicy, malty, grassy. Nose is bold but taste is softer. Dark chocolate, roasted malt, soft grassy notes, yeast extract, wood barrel but not much vanilla, slight red wine barrels.

Draft pour at the brewery. Darkest brown with a small tan head. Aroma is very complex, toffee, roasty notes, bourbon, oak, coconut, vanilla. Flavor is very well balanced, mildly sweet, nice heat, touch of roasty bitterness. Fuller body, nice feel, average carbonation, not too hot. Every bit what I hoped it would be.
Brow, beige head, aroma of toffee, wood, coconut, bourbon, caramel, dried fruits, flavor of tofffe, wood, toasted coconut, vanilla, bourbon, dried fruits, sourness, medium+ bodied.

Pour a slightly murky dark reddish brown, with no head at all. 
Aroma has tons of vanilla, dark fruits, slight marzipan, slight wood, leather, slight booze, boozy raisins. 
Taste is pretty sweet, with faint bitter notes. 
Semi full, slick and rather oily body, with as good as no carbonation. I rather like this
Small bottle. Pitch black. Dark fruit, dark chocolate, sherry. Lots of Madeira, cocoa, soy. Sweet, oily mouthfeel. Dry. Not much of the carbon left.
Aroma:caramel, chocolate, leer, mooi complex aroma. kleur brown, black, clear. De smaak is niet te zwaar medium body veel hout, rozijnen. Heel mooi bier!
On tap at the brewery. Appearance is dark brown with hints of red and a tan head. Aroma is figs and other dark fruits with bourbon. Taste follows nose.

September 9, 2016. Bottle at home, 2015 edition. 
Dark brown with a minimal tan head. Aroma is sweet malty, light roasted with caramel, figs, raisins, some bourbon notes, wood, vanilla, smooth chocolate, notes, licorice. Taste is sweet, malty, light bitter and light warming. Finish is sweet malty with caramel, vanilla, figs, warming bourbon alcohol, light bitterness with a slight roasted notes, hints of licorice. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, slight oily texture. 
Very nice!
12oz bottle 2014 release thanks to Prufrockstar- nutty upfront with some latent bourbon. Complex and earthy as the others. Flat too. Sweet to the lips. Boozy on the finish.
Bottle shared by Bvery, thanks for sharing this monster. Dark black pour, no head. Aroma is bourbon, dark fruits, some vanilla. Taste pretty much follows, a little boozy. Very delicious.
Bottle. Deep mahogany / brown pour with very minor head. Ungodly aroma - dark fruit, wood, bourbon, vanilla. Similar taste. Could use a little more carb. This is great.

Hair of the Dog, Portland. 2014 vintage bottle at the brewery, tasted side by side with the 2015 rye barrel Adam. Great sweet bourbon and vanilla aroma. Alc, syrup, maple. Vanilla extract. Warmer fruit, wood, oil, bright bourbon. Rich, clean. Tiramisu. Lighter weight. Rich, aromatic. Tons of bright bourbon.

355ml bottle @ Hair of the Dog, Portland, OR. 2015 vintage. Pours dark brown with a small white head. Aroma of ripe fruits, plums, wood, oak, bourbon, vanilla, toffee and syrup. Taste is smooth, slick and warming with loads of ripe fruits, plums, wood, oak, bourbon, vanilla, toffee and syrup. Finish is smooth and syrupy with loads of ripe fruits, bourbon, oak, wood and vanilla. Quite heavy and massive slow sipper, but really well balanced and tasty.

At the HofD brewery in Portland-USA. 2014 bottle. Dark mou dark caramel pour, no head. Nose: vanilla shake, bourbon, more sweet vanilla. Mouth: light/sweet roast start, bourbon, a bit chili finish. Mamma Mia!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A: Deep dark brown, no head at all. N: Vanilla, bourbon, liqourice T: Oak, figs, raisins, cedar, vanilla O: WOW! This is amazing! What a flavour bomb! Amazing!
Way to expensive, but besides that, this one is one to really enjoy. What a nice full taste, so much going on in every drop of this brew.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2016 
Aroma:

Malts, bourbon, butterscotch, vanilla and wood.

Appearance:

Turbid brown beer with a very slight light brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium sweet and slightly bitter with roasted malts, dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla and wood.

Pours opaque black with a slight violent tinge through it. Aroma is caramel, raisins, vanilla, bourbon and oak, Taste is sweet caramel, sweet vanilla, bourbon, oak, raisins, chocolate sweet, cocoa, alco heat. Full body.
Bottle at Stuu666s. Pours dark brown with a no real head. Aromas of oak, booze, caramel, vanilla, cream. Taste is chocolate, creamy, booze. Hot finish.

Bottle (2015). Pours a dark brown color with no head. Big oaky/sweet bourbon aroma along with raisins, molases and vanilla. Taste of vanilla, bourbon, malts, raisins and dark fruits with a lingering alcohol heat. Very creamy mouthfeel with a big body. Big and lingering aftertaste of vanilla and bourbon. Really good.

Rating #1678 - #CBC2015 Beer 63 - Day 4 - On tap at HOTD w/ Ferris. Pours an opaque dark reddish brown color, almost black. Very little white head that bubbles away quickly. Nice aroma of oak, vanilla, bourbon, alcohol, roasted malts, raisin. Smooth mouthfeel, taste of oak, vanilla, toffee, medium alcohol warmth on the palate, full bodied, lingering sweetness. Love the colour and depth that these Bourbon barrels have brought to this brew. Exquisite.

Dark brown color with basically no head. Aroma is intense on dried fruits, mostly figs and plums, with a fortified wine character. Taste is also very fruit forward, sweet but not cloying, syrupy, sticky, woody, intense and complex. Body is heavy, almost flat, a bit boozy as well. Feels like a liquor. Complex taste and aroma but feels too boozy and flat to be up there with the best of the style.

12 oz bottle, 2014 version. Pours brown with no head or carbonation.

The aroma is bakers chocolate, bourbon, black licorice, roast and some dark fruit with slightly harsh alcohol.

The flavor is sweet chocolate malts, dark fruit, roast and some strong bourbon alcohol. The mouthfeel is medium bodied with no carbonation.

Overall, very interesting with a ton going on. A little harsh on the alcohol for me. A nice decadent dessert beer,

Number 1000 rating. Dark brown colour, no head. Aroma of whiskey, oak, vanilla, raisings, dry plum, fermented fruits and tobacco. Taste is light to medium sweet, slightly tart. Nutty flavour. Medium body, oily texture, flat carbonation.

small bottle at home, 2014 batch bottle. poured a cola brown colour as flat is it can get. not even a few bubbles. nose has a very strong bourbon barrel note upfront. followed by a ton of sweet caramel malts, sticky toffee, lots of tobacco, ash, dark red fruits, charred oak, and overripe sweet cherries. taste full of ash and tobacco, followed ba a strong bourbon barrel notes, even some earthy nutmeg, and cloves, very complex beer! amazing! however the lack of carbonation is a bit of a killer
Just beautiful. Absolutely no head at all but who cares. A taste that lingers for ages.

Bottle shared by BuckeyeBoy Dark brown pour rich chocolatey tootsie roll aromas and flavors. Dark pitted fruit but clearly tatestes like its been sitting and mellowing for a long time very soft carbination
Thanks Jeremy
A dark nutty brown color. Close to no head. Peanut aroma and heavy caramel. Alcohol feel in the end. A great sipper. From what Ive had Im a huge fan of this brewery.

Had this after trying Cherry Adam From The Wood and Adam From The Wood - Rye Whiskey.
Dark brown pour, almost black, completely flat. Smells like apple brandy, cherries, plums, figs, cocoa, vanilla, bourbon and alcohol. The taste is very well balanced and quite complex, with notes of coffee, cocoa, dark chocolate up front, followed by cherries, raisins, plums, figs, vanilla, maple syrup, brandy/bourbon. After a while, I can identify some tobacco in there, as well. Very smooth and silky texture, especially due to the complete lack of carbonation. Sweet, bourbony, aftertaste. Definitely a world class beer.

Kochsgade Friday afternoon tasting in November. Black with a tiny off-white head. Intense and complex aroma with licorice, chocolate, vanilla, coconut, oak and plenty dessert wine. Sweet and extremely rich flavour with mild dark flavours, and perfectly balanced wood character
Bottle @ Orla, Bickle and Dolle goes bananaz. Pours Black with bubbles on top. Wood, roast, lakridskonfekt, mild alcohol, Well rounded, soft, licorice. The perfect sipper. Impressed!

Bottle. Pours nearly deep black with almost no head. Aroma of wood, burbon, vanilla, cocoa, licorice, dark fruits. Taste is rather sweet lakrids konfekt, vanilla, BA, bourbon, alcohol. Very smooth, strong. Den smager af whale

Bottle shared with Dutchdrebus @ Drebus birthday tasting. Opaque dark brown to black color, average sized light brown head that diminishes quickly. Smell and taste malts, firm bourbon, some alcohol, sweet malts. Balanced mouthfeel, suitable body and carbonation.
Bottle @ benzai. Black colour with a small beige head. Smells oak, wood, whisky. Tastes plum, oak, wood, roasty, sweet, cherry peel. Great. Full body, soft carbo.

Bottle shared at Ariels farewell tasting at Maxs place. Very dark brown. Great big aroma with cocoa, cookies, vanilla, bourbon, caramel, some dark fruits. Sweet flavor with caramel, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, a tart note, cookies, some dark fruits, and a bit of booziness. Full-bodied. Great stuff. Complex.

330 ml bottle from The De Molen Beershop, Bodegraven Netherlands. Pours a deep dark red color with no head at all. Aromas of dark fruits, molasses, bourbon, vanilla, oak. Taste is really intense and smooth at the same time. Caramel, bread, dark fruits, bourbon, oak, vanilla, HOLY SHIT!!!! Medium to full body with low to no carbonation.
Bottle 0,35ltr: Very dark brown colored brew with an dry bitter taste, some burn in the mouth. Hints of chocolate, vanilla, dried fruits and Bourbon.
Bottle in the hotel. Pours black, nose is toffee, vanilla, chocolate, toffee, taste is rich, sweet fruit, bourbon.

2015 12 oz bottle. Thanks Bob. Murky dark brown. Aroma of figs, raisins, sweet dried dark fruit. Oak, caramel, touch of vanilla. Taste is like chewing on a bourbon barrel flavored tootsie roll. Brown sugar, boozy without the heat. Mouthfeel is watery and uncarbonated. Seems out of place in such a flavorful beer.

12 oz bottle thanks to AdamC. Much thanks! Very dark brown, no carbonation. Aroma is long lasting bourbon with Heaven Hill all up in this brew. Some dark fruit elements, sugar cover figs, raisins, burnt molasses. 
This is one hell of a old school German style I did t even know existed. The bourbon barrel is is well integrated it is insane!! The bourbon is deep with very little alcohol noticeable anyplace. That is until you finish the sample. Very nice warming sensation after the swallow. I know the carbonation is flat but I cant really fault he brew for that, this is just very nice.

Poured from bottle thanks AdamChandler for the Ratebeer Camp extravaganza. Dark cola color with no head but nice lacing of the glass. Aromas of bourbon caramel vanilla and dried fruit. Taste is chocolate bourbon and oak.

12oz bottle shared by AdamChandler. Thanks, Adam! Pours dark brown with just a touch of beige bubble. Aroma is chocolate, big bourbon, oak. Taste is smooth, chocolate, bourbon, oak. Great flavor, no carb. Reminds me of BCBW.

Bottle from a trade, 2015 Release

A - Pours a dark mahogany red. A very tiny head that fades fast. 

S - This smells incredible. There is so much dark fruit here. Raisin, fig and a lot of whiskey. A ton of oak, vanilla and maybe even some cherry.

T - Smokey, charred oak, a ton of vanilla. The Adam elements are there just a bit thinner than regular Adam. Lingering raisin.

M - Flat mouthfeel, thin but coats the tongue and is sticky

O - Wish this wasnt thin but whoa, insane.

Deep cloudy brown. Aroma is faint but I get pipe tobacco, wood, fig. Woody flavor, roasty bitterness, bit of bourbon whisky. Very silky because of the lack of carbonation. I am really surprised at how restrained this beer is at such an elevated ABV. Almost too restrained but it improves with each sip.
355ml bottle. This one just smacks you with an oxidized aroma off the bat. The flavor is pleasant though, leathery, old, tannic, bourbonny,

2015 bottle courtesy of the wife!  So looking forward to this beer.  Appearance is syrup with no head.  Aroma of dried fruit and toffee.  A truly unique beer, the finish is clean and I found it light leaving a hint of plum.  I wish I had one to age, but well worth wait for this one.  Cheers!!
No head, dark brown. Nice bourbon aroma, oak, vanilla, toffee. Taste is dried fruits, toffee, sweet. Incredibly heavy and underwhelming.
Draft - Nice toffee and barrel notes. Cloudy brown with almost no head. Sweet caramel, light bourbon notes and a light finish. Nice.

Bottle shared thanks to kermis. Almost black with no head. Massive bourbon, vanilla, quite creamy, very woody and rye like spices, grapes, some dark chocolate. Quite sweet with soft roasted bitterness. Medium bodied with no carbonation. Very nice but it leaves me wondering how it would be with some carbonation.
World class. Bottle from Jeremy. Dark brown, syrupy, sweet, wood notes, molasses. Late warmth, excellent through and through.
Bottle. Black beer with an offwhite head. Wood, bourbon, toffee, caramell chocolate, vanilla aroma. Fruity caramell, bourbon, vanilla, licorice, chocolate, woody flavour.Lovely beer :-)

3 oz pour into a stemmed tasting glass from tap at the brewery in Portland. Black, opaque, no head. Very creamy and full bodied. Great body. Nose is sweet. Smoke, dark malt, molasses, a little booze. Taste is syrupy. A little molasses, leather, a little smoke, lots of woodiness, bourbon notes. Some booziness, but not as much as Id expect for the size. Delicious. A great combination of creaminess, maltiness, and flavorfulness.
Bottle, but I thought I had this before. Dark pour, flat. Dark Malts, fruits, spices, oak and alcohol tones. Flavors are strong, malty, fruit, sweet, boozy.

Bottle shared. Pours cloudy dark brown with no head. Aroma of vanilla, oak, molasses, soy, toffee, overripe dark fruits and booze. Flavour is light heavy sweet. Weird mouthfeel, it seems thick and watery at the same time. Medium bodied with completely flat carbonation.
Bottle at 9050 tasting. Very hot alcohol, chocolate, lots of bourbon, vanilla.

355ml bottle enjoyed @ home, 2014 bottle. Thanks to douglas88. Pours dark and muddy brown with absolutely no head. Aroma is caramel, bread, dark fruits, booze, leather, wood, prunes and raisins. Flavour is sweet and light bitter, Full bodied, no carbonation at all and I dont mind. Finish is very decadent and long. I like all the subtle flavours, very complex.

Am I the first to mention no carbonation? No? Well I kind of like it that way. Big oak and bourbon aroma, soy, figs and dark fruit. Hot alcohol heat, first so made me think of chilis actually. Fruity and lots of wood. Very very nice.

Poured from a 12 oz 2014 vintage bottle. Aroma has a rich dark caramel and toffee notes. Medium light chocolate and light roast. Hints of toasted bread and nuts. Moderate dark fruit notes of raisin, fig and prune with a bit of plum and berry. Medium oak notes and hints of soy. Pours a murky mud brown with absolutely no head. No lacing and moderate legs. Flavor has a medium sweetness with a lot of dark caramel and toffee. Moderately strong oak notes also present with hints of vanilla, coconut and almond. A light chocolate and soy note. Medium light tobacco and leather. Moderate raisin, prune and plums. Oak tannins are a bit harsh. Medium light alcohol notes. Mouthfeel is full bodied with absolutely no carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. Overall, an alright beer but the lack of carbonation really hurts it. Lots of oak character that works well with the malt but the oak tannins detract from the beer. I don?t know how it would age though as I bet the soy sauce character would creep in and overwhelm.

2014 bottle. Dark mahogany coloured pour, no carbonation. Aroma is bourbon oak, port, dates. Taste is the same with a vanilla sweet quality, some marshmallow, great oak finish. Thin no carbonation which means more port like on palate than beery. Great beer but not quite as good as Matt!
Tap at brewery, brown pour, off white head. Nose is cherry, taste is boozy, caramel, leather, smokey, wow

Bottle. Nose of bourbon, smoke, chocolate, caramel. Cloudy brown, flat. Flavor is oxidized oak, chocolate, port. Oily and flat, needs carbonation. Very tasty, rich and woody but the flatness doesnt work.

I prefer the regular version. Bourbon aroma and some in the flavor. Vanilla in the flavor and aftertaste, with the flavor and aroma of booze. no carbonation and the palate and mouthfeel are a little thin.

Bottle. Pour is dark brown with almost no head. Aroma and flavor of burnt caramel, slight vanilla, toffee, dark fruit, and booze. Finish is sweet and boozy with some brown sugar coming through. Little to no carbonation.

Via trade with Douglas88. The aroma is boozy, woody, leather, smoky, lots going on. The appearance is deep black, almost no carbonation. The flavor is bourbon, vanilla, wood, molasses. The finish is boozy, piney. Medium, slightly thick in body. Nice.

Bottle to glass. Pours a deep brown color with a light tan head. Aroma is sweet, molasses, soy sauce. Flavor is thick, syrupy, sweet, slightly smoky, oak. Medium to heavy syrupy body with a lingering soy sauce sweetness. Not too shabby.
Absence totale deffervescence qui résulte en un liquide riche et sirupeux. Bourbon, dattes, vanille, végétation, caramel, noisettes et des tanins qui équilibrent lensemble.

12oz bottle to snifter. Dark pour. Zero carbonation, as announced on the label. Nose of raisins and plums and sweetness. Complex flavors of dark fruits and oak. I would have loved this with just a little carb.

(12oz bottle) deep ruby brown, clear body, flat as a pancake. Nose smells absolutely amazing, raisin, bourbon, vanilla, wood cask, toasted marshmallow, brown sugar, complex. Taste is nice but seriously taken a step back by the zero carbonation. Raisin, caramel, vanilla, sweet and decadent. Palate is worst amongst this beers attributes, but an awesome brew all around.

pours murky brown w/ no head -aroma is boozy and caramel/coffee like--up front malt followed by smoky bourbon and woody vanilla and molasses
warm depth in the finish that is sweet but not cloying and well masked fruity alcohol

Bottle: Poured a murky dark brown color ale with zero carbonation. Aroma of tobacco, bourbon, light vanilla and molasses is quite singular. Taste is also dominated by tobacco with some molasses and bourbon notes clearly identifiable. Residual sugars are also easily identifiable with light warming alcohol. Body is quite full with almost zero carbonation. This is almost like drinking an old sherry or xeres and makes for a perfect nightcap.

Bottle courtesy of Secret Summer Santa 2014. Thank you! Pours deep dark chestnut brown with a very small goldenish brown head that quickly dissipates without leaving any trace on the glass. Smell is sweet, malty and slightly smokey with sweet dark bread, caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, smoke, bourbon, honey, soil, raisins, alcohol and hints of dill. Taste is sweet, tiny bitter, heavy malty and tiny smokey with toasted malts, caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, milk chocolate, raisins, bourbon, toasted coconut, alcohol, hay and hints of smoke. Mouthfeel is soft, round, viscous, flat, tiny oily, tiny boozy and near full bodied. Finish is sweet, tiny bitter and heavy malty with caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, biscuits, charred wood, raisins, toasted coconut, hazelnut paste, hay, soil and hints of smoke. Wow! Just wow! Would have love some slightly creamy carbonation but this beer in its regular state kick most beers butt!

Bottle thanks to _angst_. Black beer with a small head. Woody aroma, bourbon, grassy, toffee, caramel, raisins, roasted notes, chocolate, vanilla, raisins. Fruity caramel flavor, bourbon, vanilla, licorice, cream, warming alcohol, milk chocolate, hay notes, woody, raisins and figs. Full bodied, creamy and with a lovely balance. Wonderful beer!

2014 bottle thanks to trade with jdb288! Pours a murky copper brown with minimal head or lacing. Aroma is big malty sweetness over bourbon vanilla oak and dark fruits. Taste follows, complex and intense, lots of the barrel with a big boozy back end. Sweet but not overly so, definitely a good barley wine.
Bottle shared at pre-BBF14 tating at ABC Beers, Den Haag. Nice toasted malts and caramel in the nose, medium body, little booze, taste is nicely balanced between malts and the bourbon fruitiness.

"Another ridiculously amazing beer sampled on 12/16! somehow spent 3-4 YEARS in barrels, but the bourbon character, while quite obvious, is not overwhelming, and is quite complimentary. liked this way more than the regular Adam, which is already a good brew...but this one is elite! super smooth, and i kept retuning my nose to the glass for that bourbony goodness. too bad we split a 12 oz."

Botttle at the pre Borefts tasting, Den Haag. Poured a hazy mahogany. The aroma is rich boozy alcohol molasses. The flavour is rich malt molasses, ripe fruti with a rich malt boozy alcohol palate. Medium bodied with flat carbonation.

bottle shared @ Pre Borefts tasting
No head or carbonation. Clear amber pour. Wow, a lovely beer. Nice complexity.
Poured deep dark brown with no head. Aroma of sweet bourbon, smooth and sweet. Full body, flavour as the aroma.

Bottle: 2011 vintage. Thanks, Jeff. Deep brown body, almost black once it makes it to the glass. Dark ruby edges with a soft, thin khaki layer of foam resting on top. Lovely, complex aroma with signature Hair of the Dog descriptors; fig, raisin, woody oak, prune, musty leather, spicy tobacco, plentiful bourbon, earth, sweet molasses, & light touches of anise & wine. Solid battle between robust booziness & offsetting sweetness. Huge oak presence on the palate; if the "wood" part wasnt appreciated in the aroma, it definitely is in the flavor. Booze soaked oak staves, black cherries, dates, sweet raisins coated with burnt brown sugar, molasses, & a touch of vanilla. Middle to back, you get more of the signature old leather & tobacco flavor with a touch of earth, smoke, & vanilla. Boozy finish with a semi-sweet balance; malty, unattenuated, sweet, warming, & indefinitely intriguing. Thick body, oily & coating. Delicious beer, although I prefer the superior drinkability of regular Adam.

2014 bottle sent to me as a "surprise" bottle from Tom10101, thanks man! 
Dark brown pour, no head to speak of which isnt surprising as the bottle makes the no carbonation a matter of fact. Aroma, oh man I could swim in this, bourbon, oak, toffee, light smoke, yum. Taste, a bit hot up front, syrupy mouthfeel, caramel, vanilla, oak, burnt brown sugar, with a warm, bittersweet finish. This is a great beer, and with a bit of carb it would be world class, still delicious though, Ill have to track down a 2011.

Bottle @ home...vintage 14 label says 12% alc... It pours dark brown, light murky, no head (?) lack of carb. nuts, plums, oak, raisins, bourbon, leather, tobacco, toffee, brown sugar, warming alcohol.... It would have been fantastic with some carb....

Dark brown, clear, very thin tan head from lack of carb. Aroma of bread crusts, nutty notes, plums, raisins. leather, tobacco. Flavor of toffee, burnt sugar, caraway seeds, raisins. over-ripe dark fruit, leather, nuts, warming alcohol.

Bottle sampled courtesy of Sparky! One of the most generous guys on the site! Have wanted to try this FOREVER! Extremely pungent, aggressive, boozy nose with bourbon, oak, caramel, vanilla, and dark fruit. Flavor is much more subtle...reminding me of a mild Utopias. Decadent, refined, minimally carbonated, and dessert forward. Molasses, maple, and brown sugar are all there. Sip it and youll be fine...down it and youll be passed out on the couch! ;)

Pours a dark brown with no head and completely still. Nose is of coconut, vanilla and toffee, exaçtly what I expected! Taste is quite sweet but its fine for a dessert beer. Flavors are of caramel, toffee again, coconut and light raisins. Body is full, mouthfeel syrupy and smooth. Absolutely no carb and almost no hot alcohol, this drink like it is 8-9% top. Overall a really nice after supper sipper, I want more!

2014 one liter thanks to Phil. Pours a cloudy brown with small beige head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is strong oak, dark fruit, burnt caramel. Thin mouthfeel with nice booze, dark fruit, wood, candy sugar. Good.

Murky mahogany brown color, no head at all. Heavy aroma of bourbon, plum, raisin, caramel, fig, wood, hints of vanilla and chocolate. Boozy and sweet taste. Full-bodied, smooth, and thick, but very little carb. Long bittersweet finish.

Huge thanks to 5000 for sending me this 2011 bottle. Brown pour with a tan head. The aroma is awesome. I get some heavy raisin, maple, oak, vanilla and chocolate notes. The flavor is just as amazing. There is a ton of maple and vanilla notes, as well as some sap, chocolate, caramel, oak and a touch of alcohol. The flavor and aroma are incredibly complex and change each time you take a drink. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. A truly world-class beer. So happy I got to try it. Thanks again Andre.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2017 The older version with a maturation time of 7 years on bourbon barrels. I cannot thank the friendly people from Hair of the Dog enough for bringing this piece of art to the world: the maturation only adds to the complexity of their regular Adam, making this one of the best beers I ever had the pleasure to taste. Thick, pale beige head, colour very dark brown, aroma infinitely complex with hints of caramel, wood, honey, raisins, liquorice, apple cider, freshly cut strawberries, candi sugar, good quality bourbon, candied dates, vanilla, and so on, and so on - this is one of those masterpieces with a bouquet that seductive that you hesitate to even drink from it, it is as if you would want to whiff the liquid instead. Drinking it, however, is equally worthwile, as this brew immediately displays a richness, complexity and profundity of taste rarely encountered, creamy, sweet but not sticky, mildly and gently spicy, incredibly malty in a multi-layered way, lively, deep and fascinating till the end, when - apart from a toasted bitterness - warm, bourbon-like alcohol comes up only to add to the sublety and complexity. Unforgettable.
Bottle..Pour is dark black..Nose is dry oak, roast, chocolate, bourbon, alcohol...Taste is spice, chocolate, bourbon, very layered, dry oak..

Pours murky dark brown with a small head thats gone quick. The aroma has toffee, caramel, alcohol, oak, brown sugar and is kinda burly overall. It has a full thick body thats lush and no really any carbonation. The flavor starts with soy sauce, toffee, alcohol, wood, berries and sugary syrup. The finish has weird flavors that seem off to me. There is also barrel and alcohol. I thought this was okay, but expected more from the hype.

2011 bottle. WOW. I am so glad I waited for this one. The cap pops with a pssst. Carbonation,Yay! It pours a very dark brown color with a small but lasting khaki head. The aroma has wet wood, rum soaked raisins, sherry, chocolate fudge and light smoke. The flavor is infinitely complex without being messy or cloying. Light smoke and wet wood hits the palate first with nice notes of rum raisin and sherry coming through before more smoke and chocolate with plum and hints of lightly tart prunes in the finish. Wood, dark fruit and very light vanilla in the aftertaste. This is an unbelievably good beer. HotD comes through with some mind benders once and a while, and this is certainly one of them.

Bottle from trade. pours dead flat with absolutely no head or carbonation. Nose is a thick tobacco with a ton of dark fruit, vanilla, dried fruit, oh, and some booze. amazingly smooth for such a high boost beer. very smooth warming that is a secondary effect and only in the ears, doesnt burn in the chest. Mouthfeel is slightly sweet, enhanced by no carbonation. flavor is dried fruit, booze, vanilla, slightly cherry. overall, the lack of carbonation really kills this beer. even just a touch of carbonation and this beer would be a 4.5 or higher. kinda shame really.
UPDATED: JUN 11, 2014 Bottle at Nicks tasting. Pours black with brown head. nose/taste of bourbon, oak, vanilla, coconut, plum, chocolate liqueur, dark fruit and dark cherry. Full bodied.

Reddish brown colour, slightly beige head. Sweet flavour, brown sugar, wood, malts, madeira. Sweet flavour, malts, wood, red fruits. Finish sweet malts, syrup, wood, quite bitter, balanced wood. Nice beer!(from 66cL bottle @ RBBWG III, Gent 2014. Thanks for sharing, Danko!)

Poured 2014 from bottle to snifter. Dark hue with no head. Aroma is ethanol, wood, raisins, smoke, tobacco, prunes, caramel. Mouthfeel is good with a medium body but no carbonation. Taste is sweet throughout with a wood astringent following and a hot ethanol finish. Overall this will be a really nice brew after it sits in the bottle for a few years and carbonates!

12 ounce bottle. 2014 version. Pours a dark reddish brown with hardly any head. Aroma of dark fruit, malt, bourbon, and wood. Taste is cherry, plum, malt, chocolate, bourbon, and wood. Damn, wish I had more!!

Bottle shared at the Portland tasting, thanks 
Cloudy brown with a small beige head and some lacing. Aroma is woody and brown sugar. Flavors are woody, bourbon, leather and dark fruit 
Nice

A - pours a deep brownish black little to no head

s -deep and malty, plum, raisin, fig

t - starts off with an assault of dark fruit and lingers on with tobacco, charred white oak and very mild bitterness

m - thick and luscious

d - delicious and decadent. A beer for an ocassion

Bottle (12 oz). 2011 vintage. From Daniel, thanks! Reddish brown with a small ring of beige foam and no lacing. Aroma is of cherries, bourbon, booze, vanilla, port notes, plums, caramel, sweetness, tobacco, wood and the list goes on. Taste is slightly to moderately sweet with cherries, port notes, bourbon, chocolate, caramel, tobacco, vanilla, figs and a nice warming finish. Full bodied. Low carbonation. Sirupy mouthfeel. Very good sipper. Extremely complex and the balance isnt bad considering everything going on in this one.
@ RBBWG 2014. Thanks Danko! Very well balanced beer. Aroma of ripe fruits, some sweetness. Boozy character. Some light bitterness in the finish. Very well balanced. Very good.

33cl bouteille @ RBBWG III, thanks Danko.
Cuivrée, col fin beige.
Arôme offre de suite ces effluves dalcool, côté résiduel fruité rappelant des fruits noirs sur un musty boisé et léger caramel.
Palais est malté, chocolaté et caramel avec cette signature typique de HOTD. Palais offre un léger picotement grace entre autre aux notes boisées et épicées du chêne. Léger booze avec un ajout assez modeste du bourbon.

Bottle, courtesy of BuckeyeBoy  thanks a ton! Ive been waiting to try this one for quite a while now, no time like the present on a lazy Sunday evening. 2011 Batch. Popping the cap is followed by a confident hiss and a light ring of head forms in the neck. A heavy nose of malt and bourbon comes forth, layers of chocolate and dark fruits. I think of bourbon soaked graham crackers Very dark brown color and a thin ring of creamy tan head. The head bubbles away quickly ad leaves a dark snifter of goodness. Silky texture, so smooth. The bourbon accentuates the dark fruits and compliments the chocolate malt. A little peat and smoke in the end. Swirling complexities, but so very balanced. Smooth. Damn good. Adam is such a great beer memory, one of the first world-class beers I was able to try, and the barrel treatment has delivered. Excellent. Thanks again Jeremy.

Pours dark brown minimal head

Smell leather, oak and huge red fruit

Taste caramel, oak and vanilla, tobacco, red fruit and a little burn on the end, raisin

Fuller bodied

Nice

12 oz bottle at hair of the dog 2011 vintage

Murky brownish black color and a thin light brown collar. Took a bit to get a reasonable head with this. Mostly a thin layer. 
Nose was dark fruits, vanilla, chocolate, bourbon, coconut and soy sauce. Turned more towards soy as it warmed. 
Taste was pretty similar to nose. Soy crept in more as it warmed and enveloped the beer. 
Low carbonation, medium feel but a lot of soy sauce in the end. 
Walked away going it was kind of meh
Bottle 12oz at Hair of the Dog, Portland. Year 2011 made. Colour is dark brown with very small slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Bourbon, sweetness, hints of chocolate and malts.

12oz bottle. I have had this numerous times but never rated it until now. Pours out a dark brown with a small head. Aroma is molasses vanilla bourbon chocolate and roast malts. Taste is as the nose with lots of great flavors going on all the barrel notes pit fruit sweetness a good one for sure.
Draft at the source for the 20th anniversary party. Deep ruby maroon color. Aroma of port wine, dark fruit. Taste is huge, boozy, vinous port wine, brandied cherries, figs. A gigantic beer.

Aroma: Boozy, Caramel, Toffee

Appearance: Dark Brown Hue, Passes Very Little Light, Brown Head Ring, Mild Lacing

Taste: Toffee, Caramel, Booze

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Semi Boozy
Another metalgdog gem. Pours muddled brown. Hugh toffee, fig, raisin. Smooth body, holy hell.
Tap taster at brewery. The blackest of the browns. Aroma of smokey wood, raisin, and sweet sweet candy. Taste is woody, plumy, goody, sexy.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2013 2011 version at Hair of the dog anniversary party. Dark brown with very little head. Aroma is raisins, honey, dates, molasses. Slightly syrupy mouthfeel, sweet on the palate, some oak and booze on the finish. Taste is raisins, honey, dates, prunes, oak, bourbon. Delicious!

Amazing beer. Aroma has notes of chocolate, petey smoke, and leather. This is the closest scotch smell I have ever smelled from a beer. Palate is sweet but not cloyingly so; smokey flavor really comes through. Smooth and just a finish of bitterness makes this beer amazing.
Very sweet, warm, bourbony. It has a great, deep old a little flavor that is very complex and very familiar at the same time.

2011 12 oz. bottle. Pours a dark copper/brown color with a medium sized beige head after an aggressive pour. The aroma and flavor had big sweet malts, caramel, toffee, dark ripe fruits and raisins, wood, mild bourbon notes, vanilla and brown sugar. Smooth drinking and although sweet, not cloying. Solid.

Bottle, 2011 - thanks Alen! Pours dark opaque brown with a small tan head that dissipates quickly with some lacing. Aroma is full and rich with roasted malts, raisin, chocolate, molasses, and bourbon, of course. Flavor is the same, medium sweet with roasted malts, raisins, a bit of chocolate and a wonderfully strong, but not overpowering, bourbon presence. Rich and creamy in the mouth, a bit hot, but perhaps not as much as Adam itself. Wow is this beer good!

August 9, 2013 - 2011 bottle purchased at the brewery. Dark brown pour with limited head. Aroma and taste were bourbon, chocolate, wood, smoke and vanilla. Just an amazing beer that is one of the best I have tried to this point.

Shared bottle with Timfoolery. Aroma was dates, Carmel and bourbon. The bourbon flavor was overwhelming. Love the bourbon and this beer it totally my style. Will drink again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
OH YEA, this is awesome, rich complex, there is a complexity that hair of the dog is able to master that is completely stunning and this is another example, completely love this beer!

Bottle from trade. Aroma and flavor is sugared dates, toasted caramel, sweet bourbon, and light cherries. Palate suffers from low carbonation, but the flavor is just wonderful. Love me some AftW. Excellent beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From notes on 2012-05-22: Vintage 2011. Cracked this 12oz bottle after a rough day at work. Im a big fan of opening a favorite brew after a long day. 

Dark brown body, plenty of tan head. Great retention and lace give AftW top marks for the style. Surprising, since Old Ales are typically ugly. 

Nose is bursting with bourbon, vanilla, booze, and tons of malt. Cant say its my favorite aroma but certainly enjoyable. 

Malts and caramelized booze up front; bourbon makes its way in shortly thereafter. Leathery and tobacco-y too. Caramel and vanilla linger after swallowing as the alcoholic warmth soothes my throat. Superb. 

Huge, viscous body brings everything together. Tons of well-crafted flavors make this immensely enjoyable; AftW is something every beer geek needs to sample. One of my favorites!

Batch 1 magnum, big thanks mike! 

Poured into a hotd dave taster. Dark brown with no head. Looked more like a fine liquor vs a beer

Smell of warm barrel and port, light barrel char with a whisp of dark fruit

Taste was warm, alcohol notes, hint of sour bakers chocolate with a port finish. 

Mouthfeel was viscous and toungue coating

Overall, pretty awesome to have tried this

Bottle shared by northernbrews. 2011 bottle. Pours a murky dark brown color with a small head that fades quickly. Grabs the glass really well. Awesome aroma of bourbon, figs, tobbaco, leather, wood, light smoke, and leather. Taste brings out some sweet chocolate and vanilla to blend with bourbon, tobacco, and dark fruit. Medium to thick body, very oily and smooth. Just delicous. Thanks Jeff!
bottle 2011. pours murky brown with zero head. prune fig and date aroma. taste is fudge, vanilla, and dried candied fruit. very smooth.

2011 bottle.  Poured rich root beer brown with a short, swirly yellowy-beige head.  The aroma picked up sweet, spicy, peppery bourbon over toasted molasses, chocolate, and ashy malts.. barrel warmth filled the back of the nose.. coconut rounded it out perfectly at the very end.  The flavor found sweet bourbon, vanilla, and coconut at the core, with peppery notes, charred oak, and tangy fruit skins around.. finished toasty and oaky with warm peppery alcohol and rich sugars.  Heavier-bodied with low carbonation on the palate.. warm and malty.. loved it!

12oz from the brewery

A: Sits down in the glass. Dark brown and somewhat murky. Stains the glass.

N: Lots of smoke, bourbon, leather, and tobacco. Dark chocolate, brown sugar, and some dark cherry. Caramel and vanilla.

T: Superb blend of smoke and chocolate and sugar. Very balanced in terms of some sweetness, bitterness, and some salt.

M: Thick and carbonated. Easily drinkable for its ABV.

O: Doing really well. Drained this way too fast considering th price tag. Good thing theres more.

Bottle @ ZeeBra Extreme Beer Festival 2013. Brown pour. Aroma of creamy bourbon, slightly spicy, vanilla, ripe fruits. Flavor is smooth and with a huge balance. Very well drinkable, amazing complexity. Some licorice in the finish. Lovely brew.
Dark brown body and small lace. Refined chocolate aroma, raisins, bit of wood, cacao. Nice. Warming alcohol, roasted malts. Balancing yet powerful taste. Brilliant, stunning. (ZeeBra)

Bottle, from trade with MtGoat. Pours a deep dark mahogany brown body with a tiny white head. Aroma is smooth bourbon tones, deep caramel and brown sugars, nuts and hints of chocolate. Taste is bourbon woody caramel and syrup notes. Very compact and a bit one-dimensional IMO (although Im normally a sucker for bourbon BA beers). The palate, however, is what suffers the most: complete flatness does nothing for this brew. Bourbon aside, this beer is nowhere near the score it has, unless Ive been really unlucky with this particular bottle; a high ABV beer like this should withstand a cross-Atlantic journey - or two!

12oz bottle at Hair Of The Dog. 2011 Vintage. Pours a dark brown color with no head. A wonderful aroma of oak, spice and sweetness. Much smoother than the regular Adam. The flavors are full, but all come together in an amazing blend of yum.

2011 bottle at Brouwers. Was super stoked to try this one. Dark brown pour with a ruby color against the light, with little to no head. Nose is huge - fuzzy chocolate, oak, bourbon, vanilla, and caramel-drenched boozy dark fruits. Maybe the slightest hint of apple. A bit of coconut in the flavor, some leather and dust. Wow. Huge aroma, huge flavor - this one just blew me away.
Bottle, dark amber brown color with tight tan foam, aroma is chocolate, malty bourbon, vanilla, flavor is chocolate, malty, bourbon, rich cream, leather, tobacco pouch, great finish

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2013 Rating 2500.  2011 twelve oz bottle.    pours a deep dark mahogany plum hue with a tiny, quickly fading tan head.    aroma of big, luscious tobacco,  deep bourbon, vanilla kissed wet oak. molasses.  anise.   hint of soy sauce.   loving the pipe tobacco, cigar character along the big wet bourbon oak.   taste is big potent  raw tobacco, tar, smoke,  raisins, plummy pit fruits backed by a pleasant oaky bourbon booze.  warming.  bourbon is well integrated.   the lovely characteristics of regular adam shine through nicely.   like this BAL version of adam better than matt, cherry adam.    a sticky bourbon leather chocolate goodness coats the mouth.    like this just fine.  prefer regular adam.  a tad thinned out and a prick might even say flabby at times.   very good.   but regular adam is tough to improve upon, as it is, for all intensive purposes,  perfect.   Besides, Who cares? Continuous effort -- not strength or intelligence -- is the key to unlocking our potential.

12oz bottle from cavemanlawyer, thanks James! 2011 Vintage. Pours a dark brown colored body with a slight mahogany hue. Thin, creamy, tan head that dissipates quickly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is awesome. Plump, deep caramels with some chocolate and lots of wood and bourbon. A good amount of tannins from the wood, but not overly so at this point in the aging. Some leathery tobacco with a touch of char, prunes, raisins, toast, molasses, hints of vanilla, and just a slight alcohol note. Flavor is just as nice with maybe a bit more wood showing up. Rich, deep caramels, wood, bourbon, a light molasses, and some chocolate up front. A few prunes and raisins in the middle before some leathery tobacco comes in with a slightly smokey note. Just a touch of vanilla before this finishes dry and smokey, woody, slightly boozy, and somewhat rich. Lengthy, warm aftertaste following a fuller body and a soft, light carbonation. Overall, a really well done beer. Lots of barrel notes, but plenty of plump malts and a nice tobacco presence to keep the wood in check. Complex, balanced, and very tasty. I still like the regular Adam better, but this was pretty awesome.

shared with 77 ships, 
pours dark brown / black
smell is oaky
soft carbo, sweet taste ( bourbon?) again no overkill. good one indeed .

12oz bottle, 2011, from jsilva - have been looking for this one for a while so thanks. Dark mahogany with a thin biege ring around the glass. What a nose...lots of oak, prunes, some raisin, vanilla, a sweet boozy burn, caramelized brown sugar. Very low carbonation, full body, fairly sweet, boozy, dark fruit, becomes dry, more oak, port like. What a delicious beer.

Bottle. Pours with a hazed brown hued body with a small tan head. Aromas are smokey and tannic with bourbon, brown sugar, leather, boozy, sandal wood and dates. Flavors are of bourbon, medium sweet, brown sugar, raisins, cinnamon sugar, lightly smokey, wood, vanillin, earthy tobacco, tannic, allspice. Fuller bodied, warming with medium-medium low carbonation. Very tasty.

Bottle from DA! Aroma has tons going on...tobacco, vanilla, slight booze, oak, and a touch of smoke. Dark brown pour with tan head. Taste is awesome with dark stewed fruit, slight smoke, sweet figs. Super balanced between all the flavors. Medium nice body.

Bottle shared by drabmuh. Thanks Matt.

Served with Matt, Adam, Cherry Adam from the Wood, Fred, Bourbon Fred, Doggie Claws 05.

The beer is dark brown with a thin beige cap. The aroma offers bourbon, oak - very enticing, but lacks the complexity of regular Adam. Bourbon overpowers some if the more subtle aspects of the beer. Great flavor. Melts in your mouth smooth feel with alcohol heat masterfully contained. Lingering bourbon in the aftertaste, though exceptionally soft on the palate. Overall, outstanding.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-18-2011

2011 Bottle. Pours a dark brown color with a beige head. Aroma is super bourbon forward, I get vanilla, oak, leather, dark fruits of raisins and dates, tobacco, sugary notes, almost toasty notes and molasses. The flavor follows the nose, lots of bourbon, wood and vanilla, along with the molasses, dark fruits, leather funk,  tobacco, toasty notes, darker sugar and tobacco. Body is on the lighter side of full with an oily mouth feel. Overall a really nice version of Adam!

Bottle from a trade with 5000. Pours dark brown with very minimal tan head. Toffee and bourbon aroma with some oak and vanilla. Big bourbon flavor with sweet toffee and caramel, toasted malts, vanilla and.oaK. Thick, chewy body with almost no carbonation and an oily mouthfeel. Excellent! Thanks Andre.

Bottle from brewolf...thanks Micheal! - Pours deep cola with a thin tan head. Nose is lots of smooth, sweet bourbon and toffee, with a little heat. The leather, tobacco, and smoke of Adam come through, with really bold waves of malt. Taste is fantastic. Smooth and leathery, with cocoa, tobacco, lightly smoky malt, and the long buttery bourbon sweetness. Real gentle carbonation, soft and fluffy in the mouth. Fantastic.

12oz bottle from a trade on BA I believe. Pours murky dark chocolate brown with nice one finger light brown head. Aromas of chocolate, dark fruits, wood, bourbon, little doughy malts, and molasses. Flavors of bourbon, wood, chocolate, dark fruits, some dark roasted malts, and a little vanilla. Has that classic dry and smooth mouthfeel you get on a nicely aged Adam. Good stuff.

Bottle 12fl.oz.Clear dark dark brown colour with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, dark malt, roasted, chocolate malt, dry dry wood. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light heavy bitter with a long duration, vanilla, chocolate, alcohol, wood, dark dried fruit, licorice, woody, complex. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, late finish feel is light to moderate alcoholic. [20120720]  8-3-9-4-18 
Bottle 12fl.oz. @ chriso s Pre-GBBF Shindig 2012.[ Courtesy of Secret Summer Santa ]. Clear dark brown colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is heavy malty, roasted, caramel, coconut, wood, alcohol, chocolate malt. Flavour is heavy sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, raisin, dark malt, chocolate, buzz, bourbon - alcohol, wood, dark dried fruit. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat, finish feel is moderate alcoholic. [20120804]  8-4-9-4-17

4th August 2012ChrisOs Marvellous Pre GBBF Mega Tasting. Very dark brown beer, Short pale tan head. Nice nose of bourbon and wood. Smooth palate, a little soft. Mild fine carbonation. Lovely smooth bourbon with mild vanilla and some wood. Semi dry finish. A big unapologetic bourbon barrel beer but so smooth and drinkable.

2011 Bottle. Amazing beer...not sure where to begin. Aroma is a dense plum and tobacco smoke blend...heavy fruit. The taste is a rich dense raisin flavor with overtones of bourbon, reduced fruits and smokey goodness. Such a rich palate...this baby outshines some old ports Ive had. I love this beer. Thanks Neeps.

Sampled at an esbls tadting.  Black and aque with a small off white ring.  So much malt in the nose with fruit and soy.  I taste vanilla, soy, tons of malt.  Bpurbon does not come through.  This is delicious.

Bottle thanks to my 2011 SecretSanta. Dark, hazy brown pour with no real head. Aroma contains strong bourbon notes, vanilla, lots of sweet malty port like aromas as well, dark fruits, woody, multi layered and complex. Traditional tobbaco notes, very ashy. Taste is sweet, dark fruits, fruity with a lot of vanilla/bourbon and tobacco, slightly boozy finish. Palate is heavy, low carbonation, warming alcohol finish which makes it even more decadent. Really nice sipper.

Bottle at Chrisos 2012 Pre-GBBF Shindig, London. Awesome stuff. Big character, lots of raisins, alcohol-soaked dark fruits, brownies, dark sugars, earth. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Moderate blackcurrant tang, some dry chocolate. Excellent. Some woody dryness and mild spice, too. One of the top beers of the tasting.

12 oz bottle generously shared by mrfootstones.  Thanks Brian.  Pours a cola brown with a small white head that settles to a ring and leaves some light lacing on the glass.  The aroma is lots of bourbon, oak, and caramel.  There is also some smoke, a bit of tobacco, and quite a bit of alcohol.  The taste is very sweet with lots of bourbon, some plum, and a hint of cherry.  There is also lots of caramel, some vanilla, a bit of leather, and a light smokiness.  The finish is quite boozy with lingering sweetness.  Full Body.  Low carbonation.  Enjoyable, but I could not drink much of this.

Bottle at Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig 2012. A deep brown body wih a slight hazy & a fine beige head on top. Big & boozy, lots of raisin, rum, prune, woody notes with some spice & vanilla. Quite explosive in the mouth with thick, rich & warming dark, dried fruits, chocolate, wood, bourbon, rum & vanilla to taste. Full body, subtle carbonation,  softish & rounded mouthfeel with a lingering, rich, spicy sweet & lightly warming finish.

36cl, Vintage 2011, at 12%Vol, exclusive American brew, thx to Secret Santa!, very complex brew, alcoholic/sweet and slightly woody/vinous, heavy, yet balanced, hazy, nearly no head, very good brew, yet very expensive!

Bottle. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a sweetish malty woody weak bourbon aroma. Sweetish malty woody caramel spicy bourbon flavor. Has a sweetish malty woody caramel chocolate finish.

Big thanks to Alan and Paul for this one! Bottle shared @ Jebus. Aroma is huge bourbon, figs, dried fruits, caramel, molasses, wood, roasty malts, spices, this, that and more. Flavour is above squared with vanilla, coffee, liquorice and much much more.. Insane beer.
Damn I want a side by side of all Adams :)

Bottle @ Chrisos Pre-GBBF Shindig. Pours deep brown with no head. The nose is light bourbon, some chocolate and grains. The taste is light chocolate, bourbon, wood. Some nice accents of vanilla and fresh candy corn. Full bodied, mildly boozy. Overall, an accomplished beer! Impressive.
Bottle at Chris Os pre-GBBF shindig 2012. Cloudy brown pour. Chocolate, molasses and coffee aroma. Smoke, vanilla, wood and caramel flavour. Long dry, sweet finish. Darned tasty!

Deep ambery brown/black colour with a small brown head. Aroma is liquorice, strong barrel notes, alcohol and mild raisins. Bottle at Chrisos 2012 Pre-GBBF tasting (thanks Jan). It pours cloudy deep brown, with a thin beige head. The nose is beef gravy, umami aspect, wood, vanilla, spice, caramel and alcohol. Bottle at chriso...deeep brown ....deep rich molasis roast ..light honeysoftmeatty roast nose ... rich chocolate malts ... dark roast malts ... sweeet honey.. light oak ... vanilla honey finish

3oz from a 12oz bottle into a snifter.
A- Very dark brown, no head
S- Big bourbon nose, malty
T- Bourbon, chocolate, boozy
M- Thick, low carbonation
O- Nice beer but not out of this world. Enjoyed it but probably fell victim to the hype. Good bourbon character.

Serving type: bottle
